Description: Globular pottery jug with decoration in relief. Neck and handle missing. Moulded decoration of four panels, each with a goose with wings outstretched, separated by vertical decorative patterns, below a zig-zag pattern. The lower body of the vessel is also moulded with decorative patterns. Red-brown Nile silt fabric; red wash or self slip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 134, pl. XL, no. 376.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.026)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5866 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
